title: Laparoscopy
summary: Laparoscopy (from Ancient Greek  λαπάρα (lapara) 'flank, side', and  σκοπέω (skopeo) 'to see') is an operation performed in the abdomen or pelvis using small incisions (usually 0.5–1.5 cm) with the aid of a camera. The laparoscope aids diagnosis or therapeutic interventions with a few small cuts in the abdomen.[1]
